Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2013 08:22AM gotkidsandcats wrote: It was a complete hysterectomy, everything is gone. Wasn't using it anymore, anyway! lol. Had a double mastectomy, too.
Posts.Title: Post-menopausal and Zoladex momwithkidsandcats gotkidsandcats

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 10:41AM gotkidsandcats wrote: I am geting taxotere along with adriamycin and cytoxin. Lost my hair, get bone cramps, reflux and tiredness, sore mouth, but for the most part in last about seven days and it is tolerable.  I also get the neulasta shot.  If it can kick cancer butt, I am willing to put up with it. It sucked losing my hair, but looking at the big picture made it easier to deal with. Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: Taxotere taxoterrible or Taxol taxawful? Honeybear Melizzard

Posts.Content: May 26, 2011 05:41AM gotkidsandcats wrote: I had started with a painful tongue and felt numbness, also near the throat area a few days after my first chemo.  Turned out to be a miserable case of thrush.  My onc gave me a pill to let melt on my tongue.  Worked great.  Also rinsed with the baking soda and water mix and sucked on ice chips. Good luck to you.  I

Posts.Content: May 4, 2011 02:48PM - edited May 4, 2011 02:51PM by gotkidsandcats Sharalou, So sorry to hear what you are going through.  I also go to Beaumont.  I was stage IV from the start with bone mets.  They had me start on arimidex.  Well, after 6 weeks had my PET and found it was progressing.  Now it is on to TAC regime for chemo (I'm scared).  Get my port in soon and I am praying the chemo works.  I went to Karmanos for my second opinion.  It is a scary place we are all in, but what a great and supportive group we have here online.  I would love to know what onc and surgeon you are dealing with at Beaumont.  Prayers to you

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 12:50PM gotkidsandcats wrote: irish22 I have had similar symptoms with the burning sensations.  Just knowing the pain may be caused from the meds working, makes it easier to cope with. Thank you!

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2012 10:12PM gotkidsandcats wrote: My first 6 rounds of chemo made all my hair fall out.  The next 6 rounds only slowed the growth down.  My hair is filled in, just very short, curly and very gray.  At the bank yesterday, when I had to show my drivers's license, the teller asked if that was my "daughter's license".  When I said it was me, she responded, "It must be a really, really, old picture.  People are just thoughtless and open their mouths before they think.
